sen.j: 廬山寺（ろざんじ）は京都市上京区にある天台系の仏教寺院。
sen.e: Rozan-ji Temple is a Tendai Buddhist temple located in Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City.
Rozan-ji Temple is a Tendai Buddhist temple located in Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City.
Rozan-ji Temple is a Tendai Buddhist temple located in Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City.

sen.j: 圓浄宗の本山。
sen.e: It is a head temple of the Enjo Sect.
It is a head temple of the Enjo Sect.
It is a head temple of the Enjo Sect.

sen.j: 本尊は阿弥陀如来。
sen.e: The principal image is Amida Nyorai.
The principal image is Amida Nyorai.
The principal image is Amida Nyorai.

sen.j: 寺号は詳しくは廬山天台講寺（ろざんてんだいこうじ）と称する。
sen.e: It is formally named Rozantendaiko-ji Temple.
It is formally named Rozantendaiko-ji Temple.
It is formally named Rozantendaiko-ji Temple.

sen.j: 紫式部の邸宅跡として知られる。
sen.e: The temple is known as the site of the residence of Shikibu MURASAKI.
The temple is known as the site of the residence of Shikibu MURASAKI.
The temple is known as the site of the residence of Shikibu MURASAKI.

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 比叡山延暦寺の中興の祖である良源（元三大師、慈恵大師）により天慶元年（938年）に京都の北山に創建。
sen.e: Rozan-ji Temple was founded in the year 938 by Ryogen (Gensan Daishi, Jikei Daishi), the Buddhist monk responsible for the restoration of Enryaku-ji Temple on Mt. Hiei.
Rozan-ji Temple was founded in the year 938 by Ryogen (Gensan Daishi, Jikei Daishi), the Buddhist monk responsible for the restoration of Enryaku-ji Temple on Mt. Hiei.

Rozan-ji Temple was founded in Kitayama of Kyoto in the year 938 by Ryogen (also known Gensan Daishi, Jikei Daishi), the Buddhist monk responsible for the restoration of Enryaku-ji Temple on Mt. Hiei.
sen.cmt: also known 補足in Kitayama of Kyoto

sen.j: 寛元元年（1243年）に法然の弟子である覚瑜が船岡山の南麓に再興、中国の廬山にならい廬山天台講寺と号した。
sen.e: It was revived by Honen's disciple Kakuyu on the southern base of Mt. Funayama and named Rozantendaiko-ji Temple after Mt. Lu in China.
It was revived by Honen's disciple Kakuyu on the southern base of Mt. Funayama and named Rozantendaiko-ji Temple after Mt. Lu in China.
It was revived by Honen's disciple Kakuyu on the southern base of Mt. Funaoka in 1243 and named Rozantendaiko-ji Temple after Mt. Lu in China.

sen.j: 元亀3年（1571年）、織田信長の焼き討ちは正親町天皇の女房奉書により免れたが、豊臣秀吉の寺町建設によって天正年間に現在地に移った。
sen.e: A nyobo hosho (an official document recording of the orders and words of the Emperor written by female court members) from Emperor Ogimachi saved the temple from being burnt to the ground in Nobunaga ODA's 1571 attack but it was later relocated to its current site as part of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI's construction of Teramachi Street between 1573 and 1592.

A nyobo hosho (an official document recording of the orders and words of the Emperor written by female court members) from Emperor Ogimachi saved the temple from being burnt to the ground in Nobunaga ODA's 1571 attack but it was later relocated to its current site as part of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI's construction of Teramachi Street between 1573 and 1592.

A nyobo hosho (an official document recording of the orders and words of the Emperor written by female court members) from the Emperor Ogimachi saved the temple from being burnt to the ground in Nobunaga ODA's 1571 attack but it was later relocated to its current site as part of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI's construction of Teramachi Street between 1573 and 1592.

sen.j: 度々の火事のため、現在の堂宇は寛政6年の再建になるものである。
sen.e: The temple had been repeatedly devastated by fire and the current buildings were reconstructed in 1794.
The temple had been repeatedly devastated by fire and the current buildings were reconstructed in 1794.
The temple had been repeatedly devastated by fire and the current buildings were reconstructed in 1794.

sen.j: 1965年（昭和40年）に考古・歴史学者角田文衞により紫式部邸跡とされた。
sen.e: In 1965, the site was determined by archaeologist and historian Bunei TSUNODA to have formerly been the residence of Shikibu MURASAKI.
In 1965, the site was determined by archaeologist and historian Bunei TSUNODA to have formerly been the residence of Shikibu MURASAKI.
In 1965, the site was determined by archaeologist and historian Bunei TSUNODA to have formerly been the residence of Shikibu MURASAKI.

sen.j: 御黒戸四箇院のうち現存する唯一の摂家門跡である。
sen.e: Of the four okurodo (private Buddhist chapels of the imperial family located within the grounds of the Imperial Palace) it is the only one still to be served by a monzeki priest from a regent family.
Of the four okurodo (private Buddhist chapels of the imperial family located within the grounds of the Imperial Palace) it is the only one still to be served by a monzeki priest from a regent family.
Of the four okurodo (private Buddhist chapels of the imperial family located within the grounds of the Imperial Palace) it is the only one still to be served by a monzeki priest from a regent family.

sen.j: 境内
sen.e: Precinct
Precinct
Precinct

sen.j: 本堂 - 光格天皇の命による仙洞御所よりの移築と伝える。
sen.e: Main hall: Said to have been relocated from Sento Gosho-palace by the order of Emperor Kokaku.
Main hall: Said to have been relocated from Sento Gosho-palace by the order of Emperor Kokaku.
Main hall: Said to have been relocated from Sento Gosho-palace by the order of the Emperor Kokaku.

sen.j: 本尊は阿弥陀三尊（阿弥陀如来、右脇侍勢至菩薩、左脇侍観音菩薩）。
sen.e: The principal image is an Amida triad (Amida Nyorai, right flanking attendant Seiji Bosatsu, left flanking attendant Kannon Bosatsu).
The principal image is an Amida triad (Amida Nyorai, right flanking attendant Seiji Bosatsu, left flanking attendant Kannon Bosatsu).
The principal image is an Amida triad (Amida Nyorai, right flanking attendant Seiji Bosatsu, left flanking attendant Kannon Bosatsu).

sen.j: 元三大師堂 - 参道正面に位置する。
sen.e: Gansan Daishi-do hall: Stands at the front of the path leading to the temple.
Gansan Daishi-do hall: Stands at the front of the path leading to the temple.
Gansan Daishi-do hall: Stands at the front of the path leading to the temple.

sen.j: 本尊は元三大師（良源）。
sen.e: The principal image is Gensan Daishi (Ryogen).
The principal image is Gensan Daishi (Ryogen).
The principal image is Gensan Daishi (Ryogen).

sen.j: 他に毘沙門天像、薬師如来像、不動明王像などを安置する。
sen.e: It also houses statues including those of Bishamonten, Yakushi Nyorai and Fudo Myoo.
It also houses statues including those of Bishamonten, Yakushi Nyorai and Fudo Myoo.
It also houses statues including those of Bishamonten, Yakushi Nyorai and Fudo Myoo.

sen.j: 毘沙門天は京都七福神の一つ。
sen.e: Bishamonten is one of the Seven Kyoto seven gods of good fortune.
Bishamonten is one of the Seven Kyoto seven gods of good fortune.
Bishamonten is one of the seven Kyoto gods of good fortune.

sen.j: 尊牌殿 - 本堂と同様に光格天皇の命による仙洞御所よりの移築と伝える。
sen.e: Sonpai-den: As with the main hall, is said to have been relocated from Sento Gosho-palace by the order of Emperor Kokaku.
Sonpai-den: As with the main hall, is said to have been relocated from Sento Gosho-palace by the order of Emperor Kokaku.
Sonpai-den: As with the main hall, is said to have been relocated from Sento Gosho-palace by the order of the Emperor Kokaku.

sen.j: 本堂庭園 - 源氏庭と称し、白砂と苔にキキョウを配する。
sen.e: Main hall garden: Named Genji Garden and features white sand, moss and Chinese bellflowers.
Main hall garden: Named Genji Garden and features white sand, moss and Chinese bellflowers.
Main hall garden: Named Genji Garden and features white sand, moss and Chinese bellflowers.

sen.j: 墓地 - 慶光天皇廬山寺陵をはじめ皇族の陵墓が多くある。
sen.e: Graveyard: Contains the tombs of many members of the imperial family including that of Emperor Keiko.
Graveyard: Contains the tombs of many members of the imperial family including that of Emperor Keiko.
Graveyard: Contains the tombs of many members of the Imperial Family including that of the Emperor Keiko.
sen.cmt: 皇族用語統一"the" を追加しました。

sen.j: また、豊臣秀吉の築いた史跡の御土居が境内東端に残る。
sen.e: The remains of a rampart constructed by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI still stand on the eastern edge of the temple precinct.
The remains of a rampart constructed by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI still stand on the eastern edge of the temple precinct.
The remains of a rampart constructed by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI still stand on the eastern edge of the temple precinct.

sen.j: 節分の「追儺式鬼法楽」は通称「鬼おどり」、赤青黒の鬼に紅白の餅と豆を投げて悪霊退散を祈願する
sen.e: The "Tsuinashiki Onihoraku", commonly known as "Oniodori" (demon dance) held on Setsubun in which red and white mochi and beans are thrown at red, black and blue demons to pray for the casting out of evil spirits.

sen.j: 京都市上京区寺町通広小路通 (京都市)上ル

sen.j: 京都市バス・京都バス 府立医大病院前バス停 徒歩3分
sen.e: Take the Kyoto City Bus or Kyoto Bus to "Furitsu-Idai Byoing mae" bus stop and walk for 3 minutes.

sen.j: 京阪鴨東線出町柳駅・丸太町駅 (京阪) 徒歩10分
sen.e: Take the Heihan Koto Line to Demachiyanagi Station or Marutamachi Station (Keihan) and walk for 10 minutes.

sen.j: 本堂および庭園は有料

sen.j: 寺町通をはさみ西向に梨木神社、その南に京都御苑清和院御門。
sen.e: Kyoto Gyoen National Garden (Kyoto Imperial Palace Park) and Seiwa-in Gomon Gate are located to the south of Nashiki-jinja Shrine on Teramachi Street.
Kyoto Gyoen National Garden (Kyoto Imperial Palace Park) and Seiwa-in Gomon Gate are located to the south of Nashiki-jinja Shrine on Teramachi Street.

Kyoto Gyoen National Garden (Kyoto Imperial Palace Park) and Seiwa-in Gomon Gate are located to the south of Nashiki-jinja Shrine which is facing west front of Rozan-ji temple across Teramachi Street.
sen.cmt: 「をはさみ西向に」を追記しました。

sen.j: 南隣は京都府立医科大学図書館、北隣は清浄華院、その北に本禅寺。
sen.e: The Library of the Kyoto Prefectural University of Medicine neighbors the temple to the south, Shojoke-in Temple stands to the its north and to north of this is Honzen-ji Temple.
